title: how-to-use-MapR
text: work MapR, zip file needed, can uploaded starting app. also possible select online zip file contains example data. zip file must contain images displayed (stored folder called data) json file specifies images displayed depending users selection. json file can image list (image_list.json) contains group-, variable- measure names image belonging combination three. Also image, path image can found data folder, must included. Alternatively, json file can questionnaire (questionnaire.json). file must contain questions displayed user. Furthermore file must contain images displayed information answer needed display specific image. Also path image can found data folder, must included . image_list.json file questionnaire.json must structure provided example zip files. fields need attention specific values supported app: Within json files field file_type must “png” “nc”. Within questionnaire.json “multiple choice” selected, field Answers must contain list possible answers (see example files). “numeric” selected, field Answers empty. Additionally, one can specify Fill_Value prefilled input field. Fill_Value empty string (""), input field empty. field Type belonging Plots can mathematical operator (e.g. >, <=, ==, !=, >=, <).

title: how-to-use-MapR
text: start app one can use online version run following command locally: starting app zip file must uploaded clicking Import ZIP file button. Depending concent zip file (image_list.json questionnaire.json), app display different inputs can filled user. Finally, clicking button Display plot, image can displayed.

title: MapR 23.10.1
text: option upload zip files via import module DataTools. Enables access files URL, Pandora Platform, local files, online examples Example data taken :
code: #> Documentation for the Beyer2020 dataset #> #> Description: #> #>      This dataset covers the last 120k years, at intervals of 1/2 k #>      years, and a resolution of 0.5 degrees in latitude and longitude. #> #> Details: #> #>      If you use this dataset, make sure to cite the original #>      publication: #> #>      Beyer, R.M., Krapp, M. & Manica, A. High-resolution terrestrial #>      climate, bioclimate and vegetation for the last 120,000 years. Sci #>      Data 7, 236 (2020). doi:doi.org/10.1038/s41597-020-0552-1 #>      <https://doi.org/doi.org/10.1038/s41597-020-0552-1> #> #>      The version included in 'pastclim' has the ice sheets masked, as #>      well as internal seas (Black and Caspian Sea) removed. The latter #>      are based on: #> #>      <https://www.marineregions.org/gazetteer.php?p=details&id=4278> #> #>      <https://www.marineregions.org/gazetteer.php?p=details&id=4282> #> #>      As there is no reconstruction of their depth through time, modern #>      outlines were used for all time steps. #> #>      Also, for bio15, the coefficient of variation was computed after #>      adding one to monthly estimates, and it was multiplied by 100 #>      following <https://pubs.usgs.gov/ds/691/ds691.pdf> #> #>      Changelog #> #>      v1.1.0 Added monthly variables. Files can be downloaded from: #>      <https://zenodo.org/deposit/7062281> #> #>      v1.0.0 Remove ice sheets and internal seas, and use correct #>      formula for bio15. Files can be downloaded from: #>      doi:doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.19723405.v1 #>      <https://doi.org/doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.19723405.v1>
